name: male
content:
male adjective
(GENDER)
Add to word list
Add to word list
belonging or relating to men: IT is very much a male-dominated industry. What percentage of the adult male population is unemployed? He is one of the most prominent trans male athletes today. See also
masculine (MALE)
More examplesFewer examplesShe's going out with a male model.The critics picked him out as the outstanding male dancer of the decade.Industry is still a preponderantly male environment.
male adjective
(SEX)
B1 belonging or relating to the sex that fertilizes eggs, and does not produce babies or eggs itself: a male giraffe The male bird is more brightly coloured than the female of the species. This is a disease that is passed along by male parents to their offspring.
belonging or relating to a plant, or part of a plant, that produces pollen (= a powder that causes the female part of a flower to produce seeds): The male parts of the flower are the stamens and the anthers.
More examplesFewer examplesA male chicken is called a cock and a female chicken is called a hen.The male deer grows large branching horns called antlers.Edible squash blossoms are usually harvested from the male plant.Each male willow catkin is made up of many small flowers.

male adjective
(CONNECTING PART)
engineering, electronics
  specialized used to refer to a piece of equipment that has a part that sticks out and can be fitted into a hollow part in another piece of equipment: a male plug Compare
female adjective (CONNECTING PART) specialized

Related word
malenessGrammar
Female or feminine; male or masculine?We use female and male to refer to the sex of humans and animals: …
B2 a boy, man, or male animal: The male of the species is less aggressive. Among the bodies are two unidentified British males.
More examplesFewer examplesThe kitten was actually a female, not a male.He's just your average 25-year-old hot-blooded male.The female bird incubates the eggs for about sixteen days while the male brings food.He says he's a red-blooded American male!The chief suspect for the robbery is a Caucasian male.

Add to word list
of the sex that produces a natural substance that can make an egg develop into young: a male gorilla Male and female soldiers serve in the same units. male noun [ C ] us
Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio
/meɪl/
The target audience is young males 20 to 30 years old.
Add to word list
Add to word list
belonging to or relating to men: Last year 7.8% of female managers handed in resignations, compared with 6.4% of male colleagues.
used to describe a piece of equipment that has a part that sticks out and fits into a hole or space in another part: a male plug/connector Compare
female adjective
a man or boy: According to the survey, the "average manager" is a 43-year-old male.
